article:
'Downstream' in manufacturing refers to processes that occur later on in a
production sequence or production line.

Viewing a company "from order to cash" might have high-level processes such as
Marketing, Sales, Order Entry, Manufacturing, Packaging, Shipping, Invoicing.
Each of these could be deconstructed into many sub-processes and supporting
processes.

The Manufacturing process consists of such sub-processes as Design, Tooling,
Inventory Management, Receiving, Assembly, and others. The products being
manufactured are created in a sequence of processes. Any process occurring after
another is considered to be downstream.
